sentences.sContent: I applied for the post and was asked to attend an interview.
sentences.sCn: 我申请了那个职位，被要求参加面试。

sentences.sContent: She was offered the post of ambassador to India.
sentences.sCn: 她被委任为驻印度大使。

sentences.sContent: He will take up his post as Head of Modern Languages in September.
sentences.sCn: 他将于9月份就任当代语言系系主任。

sentences.sContent: Goddard has held the post since 1998.
sentences.sCn: 戈达德自1998年起一直担任该职务。

sentences.sContent: Unfortunately they were unable to find a suitable person to fill the post .
sentences.sCn: 遗憾的是他们找不到一个合适的人选填补空缺。

sentences.sContent: Mr Thomson resigned his £50,000 a year post in April.
sentences.sCn: 4 月，汤姆森先生辞去了他年收入5万英镑的职位。

sentences.sContent: She now holds a senior post in the Department of Education.
sentences.sCn: 她目前在教育部担任高级职务。

sentences.sContent: the creation of 4,000 new teaching posts

phrases.pCn: 后置处理；后加工（错后处理，后部工艺）
依据过去经济发展情形分析的

words.tran: 记录；[会计] 过帐；委派

trans.tranCn: 职位， 岗位 ； 柱， 标杆； 起点或终点标志
trans.tranOther: a job, especially an important one in a large organization
